7 vector<edge> spanning_tree::get_mst_edges ()

12 geometry_msgs::PoseArray spanning_tree::get_tree ()
13 {
14  geometry_msgs::PoseArray path;
15  vector<geometry_msgs::Pose> poses;
16  geometry_msgs::Pose pose;
17 
18  for (auto e : mst_edges) {
19  // from
20  double x = e.from % map.info.width * map.info.resolution + map.info.origin.position.x;
21  double y = e.from / map.info.width * map.info.resolution + map.info.origin.position.y;
22 
23  // orientation
24  double dx = e.to % map.info.width * map.info.resolution + map.info.origin.position.x - x;
25  double dy = e.to / map.info.width * map.info.resolution + map.info.origin.position.y - y;
26  tf2::Quaternion direction;
27  direction.setRPY(0, 0, atan2(dy, dx) + rotation);
28  pose.orientation = tf2::toMsg(direction);
29 
30  // translate
31  x += translation.x;
32  y += translation.y;
33 
34  // rotate
35  pose.position.x = x*cos(rotation) - y*sin(rotation);
36  pose.position.y = x*sin(rotation) + y*cos(rotation);
37 
38  poses.push_back(pose);
39  }
40 
41  path.poses = poses;
42  path.header.stamp = Time::now();
43  path.header.frame_id = "local_origin_ned";
44  return path;
45 }
46 
47 void spanning_tree::initialize_graph (nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid gridmap, geometry_msgs::Vector3 vec, double angle, bool vertical, bool connect4)
48 {
49  // orientation of tree edges
50  this->vertical = vertical;
51 
52  // transformation of output tree
53  rotation = -angle;
54  translation.x = -vec.x;
55  translation.y = -vec.y;
56 
57  // initialize map
58  map = gridmap;
59  int rows = gridmap.info.height;
60  int cols = gridmap.info.width;
61 
62  // empty containers
63  nodes.clear();
64  nodes.resize(rows*cols);
65  edges = priority_queue<edge, vector<edge>, compare_edge>();
66 
67  // iterate all rows and columns
68  for (int i=0; i<rows; i++) {
69  for (int j=0; j<cols; j++) {
70  // found a vertex
71  if (map.data[i*cols+j] == 0) {
72  // check von neumann neighborhood for connected vertices
73  if (i>0 && map.data[(i-1)*cols+j] == 0) {
74  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i-1)*cols+j, 1);
75  }
76  if (i<rows-1 && map.data[(i+1)*cols+j] == 0) {
77  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i+1)*cols+j, 1);
78  }
79  if (j>0 && map.data[i*cols+j-1] == 0) {
80  add_edge(i*cols+j, i*cols+j-1, 1);
81  }
82  if (j<cols-1 && map.data[i*cols+j+1] == 0) {
83  add_edge(i*cols+j, i*cols+j+1, 1);
84  }
85 
86  // check moore neighborhood for connected vertices
87  if (!connect4) {
88  if (i>0 && j>0 && map.data[(i-1)*cols+j-1] == 0) {
89  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i-1)*cols+j-1, 1);
90  }
91  if (i<rows-1 && j<cols-1 && map.data[(i+1)*cols+j+1] == 0) {
92  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i+1)*cols+j+1, 1);
93  }
94  if (i<rows-1 && j>0 && map.data[(i+1)*cols+j-1] == 0) {
95  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i+1)*cols+j-1, 1);
96  }
97  if (i>0 && j<cols-1 && map.data[(i-1)*cols+j+1] == 0) {
98  add_edge(i*cols+j, (i-1)*cols+j+1, 1);
99  }
100  }
101  }
102  }
103  }
104 }
105 
106 void spanning_tree::construct ()
107 {
108  mst_edges.clear();
109 
110  while (!edges.empty()) {
111  // select shortest edge
112  edge edge = edges.top();
113 
114  // edge connects different sets
115  if (nodes[edge.from] != nodes[edge.to]) {
116  // combine the two sets
117  unordered_set<int> s(nodes[edge.from].begin(), nodes[edge.from].end());
118  for (auto v : nodes[edge.to])
119  s.insert(v);
120  for (auto v : s)
121  nodes[v] = s;
122 
123  // add edge to mst
124  mst_edges.push_back(edge);
125  }
126 
127  // remove edge from source tree
128  edges.pop();
129  }
130 }
131 
132 void spanning_tree::add_edge (int from, int to, int cost)
133 {
134  // add edge to priority queue
135  edges.push(edge(from, to, cost, vertical));
136 
137  // create singleton set for both vertices
138  if (nodes[from].size() == 0) {
139  nodes[from].insert(from);
140  }
141  if (nodes[to].size() == 0) {
142  nodes[to].insert(to);
143  }
144 }
145 
146 bool spanning_tree::different_sets (int a, int b)
147 {
148  return nodes[a] != nodes[b];
149 }
